title: Wiper motor and linkages for LHD 1965

posts.content:
Our mechanic is sure an old porche or beetle motor is the same, but thought I'd ask here first.

Our bus has been changed to a 12v but not sure if it makes a big difference or if a 6v one can be changed.

Thanks

Some 65 had a one year unit, you need to check under the dash where it fits, you should have two threaded holes, one each side of the vent pipe, if you have a threaded hole below in the middle of the fuse box bar then I think you can use either as the later one year only attaches in the centre, the earlier unit will use the two holes.....follow.
12 v is a 67 thing, you can use a voltage dropper, but if you use the earlier unit you can get a armature to convert, BUT you can't for the one year only unit with the two fixings .
I might not have explained this to well but you might get the jest of it.


Rocket Ron

Old Porsche & Beetle wiper motors are NOT the same.
Tell me your chassis number and I'll tell you what you should have.
I'm full of cold at the moment and feeling shattered, you'll have to remind me where the chassis number it. I think I've got a photo of the engine number and m-plate but not sure on chassis

Up to about 64 they dont park, are 6v and can be converted with new armatures. 2 wires.

65 is 6V self parking motor in the old style with rods and have 3 wires.

66 is 6V self parking, new style setup with the 3rd mount and is 2 speed, 4 wires

67 is self parking, new style setup and 2 speed 12V and 4 wires

This is what I understand.

Correct.
With 3 different motors in just over a 12 month time span it is important to establish when the OP's was built, hence the request for the chassis number.
Pictures of the 6 volt versions here:
viewtopic.php?f=4&t=98582

Chassis number on a plate attached to the air box in the cab or on the right in the engine bay on the battery side, just where the rear valance joins the engine side plate with the seal, probably covered in paint - rust- oil etc so might need a bit of glass paper..........

Hope your man flu gets better soon............



Rocket

I'm getting a bit worried that I sound manly this is mummy flu mate harder to diagnose until victims reluctantly give in and admit defeat, not to be misdiagnosed as the much weaker version of man flu which can be diagnosed by the victim admitting they're sick when they sneeze twice in a row

And no, mummy flu no better, but the cobwebs were blown off me and the bus today whilst batting round the country lanes, and I lost my splitty virginity by driving it for the first time ever since we bought it in July 2013!

Decoding your M-plate your chassis number is 215104038. I suggest you tattoo this on your forearm for future reference when sourcing parts.
You will need the one year only set up as shown on the right hand side of the below diagram ( the motor is # 5).
VW made a 12 volt version of this motor, albeit it is hard to find. You could also use the 6 volt motor with a suitable voltage dropper. Please note the readily available 12 volt armatures do not fit this motor only the pre August '64 motors.
PM me if you want to know the relevant part numbers.

Cheers Ed, just like what I said but better to see it to understand, bloody mine field...
Also, if you haven't got the wiper frame then these are just as hard to find too.
If this was my van I plumb for a 12 v setup from 67, easier to source parts and it should fit too.

Rocket
Are any of you lot going to the AGM? May need help there

See my Peebles thread ....after guidance from VWed (humble apologies yet again) I ended up going to wiperman in the USA who had an NOS 6v motor and a used frame. He modified a 12v armature and restored the frame.
Not cheap but it is all Og bits with some modern tabs and washers and and NOS motor..
Did not cost much more than buying an unknown second hand one from the resellers over here..
See a thread I did showing his work.. Search for wiperman
He still has stocks..
Strange I now have three buses all in the 1965 MY September 1964 to Janauary 1965.

I have now found in my stash a 12v bus motor to use with my 1962 set up...again after help from vwed so i think.... ia m sorted...for the 1962
I will be selling all my odd motors and parts to clear some space..
Sadly no 1965 frames though. I do have spare NOS spindles (thanks again VWed from eBay) and now a spare 1965 motor ( Thanks Rich) ...only right when I have three buses with thse fitted.
